intro: Calathiana utriculosa, commonly known as the bladderleaf, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, inflated seed pods that resemble small bladders. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and produces showy blue to purple flowers. Its leaves are alternate and have a hairy texture, while its stems are upright and branched. Calathiana utriculosa is often found in sandy or loamy soils and is adapted to partial shade conditions.
